lead_paragraph: A “Slap Shots” note on Saturday with an article about the Stanley Cup finals rematch between the Detroit Red Wings and the Pittsburgh Penguins referred incorrectly to the history of such rematches since 1927. There have been 10 others — not nine — and the reigning champions have compiled a 7-3 record, not 7-2. (In addition to the 1933 Rangers and the 1984 Edmonton Oilers, the 1956 Montreal Canadiens also defeated the team that had won the year before.).
